author: sky.cactus
content:
Are any/all of the following transactions valid in a block?
A. Account Balance: 0.00021 ETH; Base Fee: 10e9; Max Fee: 10e9; Priority Fee: 1e9; Gas Limit: 21,000; Gas Used: 21,000
B. Account Balance: 0.00021 ETH; Base Fee: 10e9; Max Fee: 11e9; Priority Fee: 1e9; Gas Limit: 21,000; Gas Used: 21,000
C. Account Balance: 0.00021 ETH; Base Fee: 10e9; Max Fee: 10e9; Priority Fee: 1e9; Gas Limit: 50,000; Gas Used: 21,000 
D. Account Balance: 0.00021 ETH; Base Fee: 10e9; Gas Price: 11e9; Gas Limit: 21,000; Gas Used: 21,000
E. Account Balance: 0.00021 ETH; Base Fee: 10e9; Gas Price: 11e9; Gas Limit: 50,000; Gas Used: 21,000

author: sky.cactus
content: In all of them, `naive_gas_price * gas_limit > account balance`.  They are all variations on that theme.

author: sky.cactus
content: However, all of them have enough balance to cover exactly `base_fee * gas_used`.

author: pietjepuk
content:
Afaict based on EIP-1559, `effective_gas_price * gas_limit` is the minimum required [0]. I'm not sure I follow e.g. your "E" example, that one doesn't satisfy your `naive_gas_price * gas_limit > account balance` right?

Also, the balance check is `>= 0` (not `> 0`). 

[0] There was an issue with this at some point with EIP-1559, whether the sender's balance had already had the transferred amount deduced or not. Not relevant for your examples as there is no transfer of ETH involved, but nonetheless related: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/3681 / https://github.com/ethereum/execution-specs/blob/master/network-upgrades/retrospectives/london.md
